clinical_study.brief_title: Gamification in the Treatment of Spider Phobia
clinical_study.official_title: Testing a Gamified App to Reduce Avoidance and Fear of Spiders in Spider Phobia

brief_summary.textblock: Mobile applications are more and more considered when implementing programs for treating mental disorders. The study aims to reduce avoidance and fear of spiders in spider-fearful individuals by combining exposure principles with gamification elements (e.g. narrative background, level progression, points, feedback). We investigate the efficacy of the gamified app in a remote online-therapy context.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in avoidance behavior (Behavioral Approach Task; BAT)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; (after one-session exposure if applied); Post-treatment (1-week after baseline); 3-week follow-up (4-weeks after baseline)
primary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0 ("participant refuses to enter the room with spider") to 12 ("participant holds the spider at least for 20 sec").

primary_outcome.measure: Change in spider fear (Spider Phobia Questionnaire; SPQ)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; Post-treatment (1-week after baseline); 3-week follow-up (4-weeks after baseline)
primary_outcome.description: The scale ranges from 0-31. High scores reflect high subjective levels and low scores low subjective levels of spider fear.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in spider fear: Spider-Anxiety Questionnaire (FAS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; Post-treatment (1-week after baseline); 3-week follow-up (4-weeks after baseline)
primary_outcome.description: The scale ranges from 0-108. High scores reflect high subjective levels and low scores low subjective levels of spider fear.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in disgust before and after playing the app
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before starting and immediately after completing the game
secondary_outcome.description: Seven-point rating scale scoring from 0 to 6: high scores reflect high levels and low scores low levels of experienced disgust; participants play twice a day (between 8 - 11 am and 4 - 7 pm); ratings are part of the app

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in arousal before and after playing the app
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before starting and immediately after completing the game
secondary_outcome.description: Seven-point rating scale scoring from 0 to 6: high scores reflect high levels and low scores low levels of experienced arousal; participants play twice a day (between 8 - 11 am and 4 - 7 pm); ratings are part of the app

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in anxiety before and after playing the app
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before starting and immediately after completing the game
secondary_outcome.description: Seven-point rating scale scoring from 0 to 6: high scores reflect high levels and low scores low levels of experienced anxiety; participants play twice a day (between 8 - 11 am and 4 - 7 pm); ratings are part of the app

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Post-treatment (1-week after baseline); 3-week follow-up (4-weeks after baseline)
other_outcome.description: Measures severity of depression; The scale ranges from 0-63: 0-13 minimal depressive symptoms; 14-19 mild symptoms; 20-28 moderate symptoms; 29-63 severe symptoms.

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Post-treatment (1-week after baseline); 3-week follow-up (4-weeks after baseline)

other_outcome.measure: German version of the Client Satisfaction Questionnaire (CSQ-8)
other_outcome.time_frame: (after one-session exposure if applied), Post-treatment (1-week after baseline); 3-week follow-up (4-weeks after baseline)

other_outcome.description: Questionnaire assessing the quality of new user-oriented health applications

intervention.description: Confrontation with spiders via gamified app

intervention.description: Massed exposure therapy over the course of one single session, applied in a remote-online context

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Participants must
- be 18 years or older,
- SPQ score ≥ 14
- BDI-II score ≤ 18
Exclusion Criteria:
Participants will be deemed ineligible if they do not meet the above inclusion criteria or
- are allergic to spiders or bee stings,
- are currently undergoing psychotherapeutic and/or psychopharmacological treatments,
- are experiencing current psychosis, mania, or substance abuse, or
- successfully complete 8 or more of 12 possible BAT steps at baseline (to ensure that participants are indeed spider fearful)
- are at higher risk from Covid-19 or
- participated in a pilot study in 2019.
